name: Parkour Theory
desc: A multimodal dataset for few-shot learning consisting of relational, text, video data of parkour techniques. Data pipeline for collection, validation, and processing, and preliminary results will be made available soon.

name: Secure Multi-Party Learning
auth: Justin Chen, Frederick Jansen, Andrei Lapets
desc: We implemented a distributed deep learning framework, which we call SMPL pronounced [sim-puh l] on top of PyTorch and a novel distributed gradient-based optimization, which we call Hypergraph Stochastic Gradient Descent (HGSGD).

name: Boston University MIC Fundamentals of Deep Learning Workshop
auth: Justin Chen, Rex Wang, Mona Jalal, Ninad Tungare, Charles Ma, Jinghu Lei, Duy Nguyen, Tyrone Hou, Chloe Kaubisch, Tammy Qiu, Brian Fakhoury
desc: We created a semester-long workshop for Boston University Machine Intelligence Community's first Fundamentals of Deep Learning workshop.

name: Current State-of-the-art Research & Artificial Intelligence in Anime
desc: This panel will highlight the differences between artificial intelligence portrayed in anime and the state of artificial intelligence research today. The presentation will cover a brief history, the state-of-the-art, the future of artificial intelligence, and how far we are today from some of the artificial intelligence technology in anime. The panelists will dissect and discuss the plausibility of artificial intelligence technologies from specific anime such as Ghost in the Shell, Ergo Proxy, and other anime. To wrap things up, there will be a live demonstration of Beating the World's Best at Super Smash Bros. with Deep Reinforcement Learning paper and real-time Neural Style Transfer.
year: Anime Boston, April 1, 2017 11-12 PM Hynes Workshop room 208
